content.question:
In a certain signal transduction pathway, the binding of an extracellular molecule to a cell-surface protein results in a rapid increase in the concentration of cyclic <math alttext="A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> inside the cell. The cyclic <math alttext="A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> binds to and activates cytosolic enzymes that then activate other enzymes in the cell.
Which of the following statements best describes the role of cyclic <math alttext="A M P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the signal transduction pathway?

choices.label: It acts as a signaling molecule that passes the signal from the cell to other cells.
It acts as a receptor that carries the signal from outside the cell to inside the cell.
It acts as a second messenger that helps relay and amplify the signal within the cell.
It acts as a channel protein that transmits the signal across the cellâ€™s nuclear membrane.

content.answer: It acts as a second messenger that helps relay and amplify the signal within the cell.
